responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Template Injection in HTML Template"
    analysis: |
      The system generates HTML content based on templates where values like 'lang', 'dir', 'author-meta', 'date-meta', 'keywords', 'title-prefix', 'pagetitle', and other user-controlled inputs are directly embedded into the HTML output without proper sanitization or encoding. An attacker can inject malicious code or scripts through these template variables, which will be rendered directly by the browser, leading to XSS attacks or other client-side exploits.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "doc/template.html"
    classification: "very promising"
```

leads.headline: Template Injection in HTML Template
leads.analysis: The system generates HTML content based on templates where values like 'lang', 'dir', 'author-meta', 'date-meta', 'keywords', 'title-prefix', 'pagetitle', and other user-controlled inputs are directly embedded into the HTML output without proper sanitization or encoding. An attacker can inject malicious code or scripts through these template variables, which will be rendered directly by the browser, leading to XSS attacks or other client-side exploits.
